SEARCH
Package com.root14.barcodeservice.controller

Class BarcodeGeneratorController

java.lang.Object
com.root14.barcodeservice.controller.BarcodeGeneratorController
@RestController public class BarcodeGeneratorController extends Object
REST controller for handling barcode generation requests.

This controller exposes an endpoint to generate barcodes in various formats using query parameters. The generated barcode is returned as a PNG image.

Example request: 

 GET /generate?type=CODE_128invalid input: '&data'=12345678invalid input: '&width'=300invalid input: '&height'=100

Required parameters:

  • type - The barcode format to generate (e.g., CODE_128, QR_CODE, etc.).
  • data - The content to encode within the barcode.
  • width - The desired width of the barcode image.
  • height - The desired height of the barcode image.

Response:

  • HTTP 200 with image/png content if successful
  • HTTP 400 if width or height is missing

Dependencies:

  • BarcodeService for actual barcode image generation.

  • Method Details

    • generateBarcode

      @GetMapping("/generate") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> generateBarcode(@RequestParam(value="type",required=true) String type, @RequestParam(value="data",required=true) String data, @RequestParam(value="width",required=false,defaultValue="400") int width, @RequestParam(value="height",required=false,defaultValue="400") int height, @RequestParam(value="store",required=false,defaultValue="false") boolean store) throws IOException, com.google.zxing.WriterException
      Generates a barcode image based on the provided type and data.

      This endpoint accepts the barcode type (e.g., "QR", "CODE_128"), the data to encode, optional dimensions (width and height), and a flag to store the generated barcode. It returns an ImageObject containing the UUID, image bytes, and creation timestamp.

      Parameters:
      type - The type of barcode to generate (e.g., "QR", "CODE_128"). This parameter is **required**.
      data - The data to be encoded in the barcode. This parameter is **required**.
      width - The width of the barcode image in pixels (optional, defaults to 400).
      height - The height of the barcode image in pixels (optional, defaults to 400).
      store - If true, the generated barcode will be persisted to the database (optional, defaults to false).
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing the generated ImageObject on success. Returns a 404 Not Found if the barcode generation service returns an empty result, or a 500 Internal Server Error if an unexpected error occurs during generation.
      Throws:
      IOException - If an I/O error occurs during barcode generation.
      com.google.zxing.WriterException - If an error occurs during barcode encoding (e.g., invalid data for the specified type).

    • getBarcode

      @GetMapping("/getBarcode") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> getBarcode(@RequestParam(value="uuid",required=true) String uuid)
      Retrieves a previously stored barcode image by its UUID.

      This endpoint fetches a barcode associated with the provided UUID. If found, it returns the barcode image as a PNG file with a 200 OK status. The image is sent with an `inline` content disposition, suggesting browsers display it directly. If no barcode is found for the given UUID, a 404 Not Found status is returned.

      Parameters:
      uuid - The unique identifier (UUID) of the barcode to retrieve. This parameter is **required**.
      Returns:
      A ResponseEntity containing:
      • The barcode image as a PNG byte array with HTTP status 200 OK if found.
      • HTTP status 404 Not Found if no barcode is associated with the provided UUID.
